instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime, no video
threads.message:
Hi. 

I dont have any history on the board. No chime, no video, fans go high. Here are measurements. 

PPBUS - 12.58
PP3V42 - 3.48
PPVRTC - 3.343
PPVIN _S5_HS - 12.58
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU</SIGNAL> - 12.58
PPDCIN - 16.58
PPVCORE- 1.158

Thanks. Have a good one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime, no video
threads.message: Are you sure no video?? or just backlight missing.... Do a PRAM reset first.and connect speakers of course...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime, no video
threads.message: Hey Aprendiz. Yes, no video whatsoever. No chime with speaker attached. Fan doesnt do the one spin thing when first powered on. Cannot PRAM. USB mouse lights up. Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime, no video
threads.message: Symptoms of bad GPU also, heat it up to confirm.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime, no video
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime, no video
threads.message:
Hi. Heated up GPU. Still nothing. 1.108 on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL>
Thanks. Have a good one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime, no video
threads.message: 1.1V on GPU Vcore means GPU is not recognized. Was this already messed with? Caps in PCIe lines not damaged?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no chime, no video
